Package org.blockchainnative.ethereum

Class EthereumContractWrapperGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.blockchainnative.ethereum.EthereumContractWrapperGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContractWrapperGenerator
    public class EthereumContractWrapperGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements ContractWrapperGenerator
    Generates wrapper classes for Ethereum smart contracts.

    Supported Types

    Classes built by this generator can natively convert the following application binary interface (ABI) types to their corresponding Java type and vice versa. However, be careful of potential precision loss when using primitive value types for big numbers.

    ABI Type Java Type
    bool boolean
    bytes, bytes8 - bytes256 byte[]
    uint, uint8 - unit256, int, int8 - int256 BigInteger, byte, short, int, long
    string, address String
    static array, dynamic array [], List<>
    ABI to Java type mapping

    For every other type, type converters need to be registered. However, in order to convert lists and arrays of custom objects, only a type converter for the specific object is required.
    Consider the following example. Assume the smart contract's method 'getSpecialObject' returns a uint[]. In order to be able to convert the smart contract result to List<SpecialObject>, only a type converter is needed that is able to handle objects of type SpecialObject, arrays and lists are unrolled automatically. The same applies for arguments. 

    
     public interface MyContract {

         List<SpecialObject> getSpecialObjects();

         public class SpecialObject {
              public int number;
         }
     }

    Special Arguments

    All contract methods can handle the following special arguments, however, passing them to methods which do not result in a transaction (i.e. methods marked as readonly ContractMethod.isReadOnly(), MethodInfo.isReadOnly()) has no effect.

    Gas Price

    Specifies the gas price used for the transaction in Wei.
    If no such parameter is declared or its value is passed as null, a default value will be chosen.
    A parameter declared as such needs to be of type BigInteger or Number.

    Gas Limit

    Specifies the gas limit used for a transaction.
    If no such parameter is declared or its value is passed as null, a default value will be chosen.
    A parameter declared as such needs to be of type BigInteger or Number.

    Value

    Specifies the amount of Ether (in Wei) to be sent in a transaction.
    If no such parameter is declared or its value is passed as null, no Ether will be sent.
    A parameter declared as such needs to be of type BigInteger or Number.

    Special Methods

    Deploy

    A method marked as special method and named 'deploy' (Constants.DEPLOYMENT_METHOD) is mapped to the constructor of the Ethereum smart contract. All parameters not marked as special arguments are converted and passed to the constructor.
    Such method can either be void or return String. In the later case, the address to which the contract has been deployed is returned.
    In order to be able to deploy the smart contract, its EthereumContractInfo needs to specify the contracts binary.

    Since:
    1.0

    • Constructor Detail

      • EthereumContractWrapperGenerator

        public EthereumContractWrapperGenerator​(java.util.function.Supplier<org.web3j.protocol.Web3j> clientFactory,
                                        java.util.function.Function<org.web3j.protocol.Web3j,org.web3j.tx.TransactionManager> transactionManagerFactory,
                                        TypeConverters typeConverters)
        Initializes a new EthereumContractWrapperGenerator.

        For each contract wrapper, a new instances of Web3j and TransactionManager are retrieved via its factories.
        It is possible for those factories to always return the same instance.

        Parameters:
        clientFactory - factory producing Web3j instances for communicating with an Ethereum node.
        transactionManagerFactory - factory producing TransactionManager instances for authorizing transactions. An instance of Web3j produced via clientFactory is passed to this function.
        typeConverters - additional TypeConverter, may be null

    • Method Detail

      • generate

        public <TContractInfo extends ContractInfo<TContractType,?,?>,TContractType> TContractType generate​(TContractInfo contractInfo)
        Generates a new wrapper for the smart contract described by contractInfo.
        Although defined otherwise by the interface, contractInfo needs to be of type EthereumContractInfo.
        Specified by:
        generate in interface ContractWrapperGenerator
        Type Parameters:
        TContractInfo - type of the contract info, required to be EthereumContractInfo
        TContractType - Java interface declaring the smart contracts methods and events
        Parameters:
        contractInfo - contract info representing the smart contract
        Returns:
        implementation of the given smart contract interface TContractType
